intro: Cochlioda floryi, commonly known as the Florida cochlioda, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Cochlioda floryi is often found in wetlands and along the edges of water bodies, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
